{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3175747,"name":"Emre Candabakoğlu","username":"emrecandabak","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-28T22:26:27.850Z","cooked":"

As team 7285 Beşiktaş Rsports, we have recently been competing in Istanbul Regional.

We had no issues overall with our robot until the qual match 60. In that match, after the autonomous we were able to control
everything on our robot except the holonomic rotation, even though the robot was able to rotate successfully in auton. After the match,
we went back to the pit, tested everything, and there were no issues. We could not find the source of the issue and have never encountered it
until the final tiebreaker match. In the final match, the same issue appeared, however, we were able to collect a cone and then score it using our vision align function, which also rotates the robot to it’s starting angle. So the robot was able to rotate using that spesific command as well. Field oriented drive was also working so it does not seem to be an issue related to the gyro.

The match footage are available and you can check them using the links below:

The Blue Alliance

Quals 60 - 2023 Istanbul Regional

Quals 60 at the 2023 Istanbul Regional FIRST Robotics Competition in Sanyer, 34, Turkey.

The Blue Alliance

Finals 3 - 2023 Istanbul Regional

Finals 3 at the 2023 Istanbul Regional FIRST Robotics Competition in Sanyer, 34, Turkey.

Now looking for the source of that issue, the potential problems could be about:

  • A bug in our robot’s program
  • An issue with the driver station laptop
  • A misfunctioning joystick

We are using a slightly modified version of team 364’s BaseFalconSwerve(GitHub - Team364/BaseFalconSwerve) for our robot.
You can find the default command to control our drivetrain in teleop here: TeleopSwerve (yfr4wcby) - PasteCode.io
We do not use any other methods other than the drive method in the class above to control the drivetrain.

Since the X velocity, Y velocity and the Rotation velocity are always calculated and used at the same time, and since we are able to drive in X and Y axes, the calculated rotation velocity must be zero for this problem to occur. Rotation velocity can only be zero if there’s an issue with SlewRateLimiter’s calculate method, or the supplied double value from the joystick is zero. Since we use SlewRateLimiter for X and Y velocities as well, it does not seem to be an issue related to that class. Unfortunately we haven’t been logging the joystick inputs, so it is not possible for us to check and see if there are any issues on that side.

Since all other functions on both joysticks were working, it does not seem to be an issue related to the laptop either.

Even though it was a bit late to notice, we’ve learned that the joystick used for controlling the drivetrain fallen to the ground 2 times before that issue started to appear. So we will for sure change the joystick for our upcoming event.

Because of the reasons we’ve discussed with my teammates above, we strongly suspect that it is related to the joystick. However, we haven’t been able to reproduce the issue even though we’ve tried for hours in our workshop. Also, there was no such issue before the event, while we were practicing with the robot (We probably have done ~100 practice matches) and testing. We’re planning to add some back-up buttons to the joysticks to force the robot to rotate so we can still be able to contribute in the match if we have the issue again.

One interesting thing is that in finals 3 match, our addressable LED’s were also randomly changing colors, which can be related to this issue or not, we assume it was just an issue with a loose PWM wire or some noise in RoboRIO PWM line. We have switched to a new RoboRIO as well, in case the issue was related to RoboRIO.

Has anyone encountered a similar issue? If yes, what have you done to fix this? Or any ideas about what can be the reason of this issue?
We haven’t been able to reproduce the issue so it’s difficult for us to find the source. We have checked the match logs and there are no issues with the RoboRIO CPU or CAN usage, it all seems fine.

Thank you,

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-28T22:45:55.461Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":258,"readers_count":257,"score":71.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":432186,"topic_slug":"critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed","display_username":"Juan Chalupa 3rd","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed/432186/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3175801,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-28T22:57:03.737Z","cooked":"

Your Robot Inspector should already have checked this, but are you using the latest (23.1) version of DriverStation? There was a critical fix related to joystick input.

Also consider using the “Rescan” button on the “USB Devices” tab on the driver station if this happens again.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-28T22:59:50.794Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":245,"readers_count":244,"score":119.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432186,"topic_slug":"critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed/432186/3","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3175804,"name":"Yiğit ","username":"Yigit","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/yigit/{size}/254511_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-28T22:58:41.207Z","cooked":"

Are you sure that the joystick appeared connected on the Driverstation app? We always check whether they’re connected before our matches because sometimes it doesn’t see the joystick ( on the 23.1 version), unplugging and plugging again fixes the issue, could be an issue with our laptop’s USB port though.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-28T22:58:41.207Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":245,"readers_count":244,"score":99.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432186,"topic_slug":"critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed","display_username":"Yiğit ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55282,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7466 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed/432186/4","custom_user_title":"7466 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3175806,"name":"Emre Candabakoğlu","username":"emrecandabak","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-28T23:02:49.714Z","cooked":"

Yes, we’re using the latest version. And we always check if there are any issues with the joysticks before the matches, use the “rescan” button as well to make sure it is all good as @Yigit also suggested. As I mentioned, everything except rotation works, so if the joystick did not connect at all to the laptop or if DriverStation could not recognize it, I assume the remaining buttons would not be working as well.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-28T23:02:49.714Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":234,"readers_count":233,"score":66.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":432186,"topic_slug":"critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed","display_username":"Emre Candabakoğlu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":38743,"username":"bovlb","name":"Gavin Matthews","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41225,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7108-7285 Alum, 8159 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed/432186/5","custom_user_title":"7108-7285 Alum, 8159 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3175858,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T00:28:26.303Z","cooked":"

I don’t see any obvious issues in the code you posted. We might be able to tell more if you posted your whole repo. More logging might help.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T00:28:26.303Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":200,"readers_count":199,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432186,"topic_slug":"critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":41225,"username":"emrecandabak","name":"Emre Candabakoğlu","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/838e76/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed/432186/6","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3175887,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T01:11:29.085Z","cooked":"
emrecandabak:

A misfunctioning joystick

What type of joystick? Some of these have a mode switch or button that makes them emulate different types of input device. You seem to have considered the most likely causes…

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T01:11:29.085Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":172,"readers_count":171,"score":54.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":432186,"topic_slug":"critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed/432186/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176111,"name":"Emre Candabakoğlu","username":"emrecandabak","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T08:26:33.861Z","cooked":"

We are using a 9th gen xbox controller, as far as i know, there isn’t a mode switch button on it, but i’m not 100% sure.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T08:26:33.861Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":32.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432186,"topic_slug":"critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed","display_username":"Emre Candabakoğlu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":14283,"username":"nuttle","name":"Allen Nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41225,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7108-7285 Alum, 8159 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed/432186/8","custom_user_title":"7108-7285 Alum, 8159 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176179,"name":"Dylan Powers","username":"Dylan1259","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dylan1259/{size}/161876_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T12:24:03.072Z","cooked":"

This does seem like a very strange issue that a few people from CD probably cant solve. If you cant replicate thr problem at home i would reccomend not spending a ridiculous amount of time on it.

Instead look into the DataLogManager from WPILib and integrate that into your code. I would also highly suggest using AdvantageScope to view log files.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T12:24:03.072Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":32.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":432186,"topic_slug":"critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed","display_username":"Dylan Powers","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":41225,"username":"emrecandabak","name":"Emre Candabakoğlu","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/838e76/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":42126,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/critical-swerve-drive-issue-help-needed/432186/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176621,"name":"Emre Candabakoğlu","username":"emrecandabak","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T20:35:19.015Z","cooked":"

Hey, thanks for your reply. I’ve integrated the DataLogManager into our code to make sure if the issue appears again we would have a clue if it was related to the controller. The issue did not appear in our workshop while practicing for the last 2 days, however our next event is at this friday and we still do not know the actual source of the issue.
